y - absolute y position in millimters relative to the home position. Range betwen [0..???]
z - absolute z position in millimters relative to the home position. Range between [0..???]

machineWait

public void machineWait(double milliseconds,
                        boolean fastExtrude)
All machine dwells and delays are routed via this function, rather than calling Thread.sleep - this allows them to generate the right G codes (G4) etc. The RS232/USB etc comms system doesn't use this - it sets its own delays. Here do no delay; it makes no sense for the simulation machine

Parameters:
milliseconds -

waitWhileBufferNotEmpty

public void waitWhileBufferNotEmpty()
Description copied from interface: Printer
If we are using an output buffer, it's a good idea to wait till it's empty between layers before computing the next one.

Description copied from interface: Printer
